publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4826 Nanette Milne: Aberdeen, UK City of Culture 2013—That the Parliament supports the bid by Aberdeen City Council to be UK City of Culture 2013; notes that Aberdeen already has many cultural events including the world-renowned Aberdeen International Youth Festival and the Word Festival at the University of Aberdeen, and wishes Aberdeen, apparently the sole Scottish city to bid so far, the best of luck in achieving its ambition. Supported by: Jackson Carlaw*, Ted Brocklebank*, Bill Aitken*, Jamie McGrigor*, John Lamont*, Elizabeth Smith*, Nigel Don*, Bill Kidd*, Jim Tolson*, Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*, Robin Harper*, Maureen Watt*

S3M-4826 Nanette Milne: Aberdeen, UK City of Culture 2013—That the Parliament supports the bid by Aberdeen City Council to be UK City of Culture 2013; notes that Aberdeen already has many cultural events, including the world-renowned Aberdeen International Youth Festival and the Word Festival at the University of Aberdeen, and wishes Aberdeen, apparently the sole Scottish city to bid so far, the best of luck in achieving its ambition. Supported by: Jackson Carlaw, Ted Brocklebank, Bill Aitken, Jamie McGrigor, John Lamont, Elizabeth Smith, Nigel Don, Bill Kidd, Jim Tolson, Stuart McMillan, Gil Paterson, Robin Harper, Maureen Watt, Mary Scanlon*, Brian Adam*, Mike Pringle*, Aileen Campbell*
S3M-4826 Aberdeen, UK City of Culture 2013 (lodged on 10 September 2009) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-4826 Aberdeen, UK City of Culture 2013 (lodged on 10 September 2009) Linda Fabiani*
